titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the George L. Kirchmyer Collection of Song Lyric Lantern Slides, circa 1920-1938
Kirchmyer (George L.) Collection of Song Lyric Lantern Slides
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: George L. Kirchmyer Collection of Song Lyric Lantern Slides, circa 1920-1938
did.physdesc: 1 linear foot (145 lantern slides in 3 containers )
did.materialspec: The majority of the slides are glass.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 145 large format slides that form 37 sets corresponding to popular song lyrics.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], George L. Kirchmyer Collection of Song Lyric Lantern Slides, circa 1920-1938, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George L. Kirchmyer was born July 30 1893. He grew up in Buffalo, New York. He graduated from the Academic Department division (high school) of Canisius College in 1909. Kirchmyer became a musician, working as a pianist and organist, as well as a choral director and teacher of voice, piano, and organ. He worked extensively as a theater organist, accompanying silent films at venues such as Shea's Theater in Buffalo. He served as choral director at the Holy Name of Jesus Church in Buffalo and for the Buffalo Knights of Columbus Chorus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 145 large format slides that form 37 sets corresponding to popular song lyrics. They would have been used to engage audiences in sing-alongs during intermissions or reel changes at movie theaters while George L. Kirchmyer performed the songs at the theater organ. Only one of the slides contains illustrations beyond the song lyrics. While the songs themselves were written 1899-1938, the slides were most likely issued dating from the 1920s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by slide set (not necessarily the same as song) title.
